bar_chart_race_description: Dynamic bar chart is usually used to show data changes over time. Through this page you can customize data and time to generate beautiful dynamic bar charts, and supports a large number of custom settings.

snake_description: Classic Snake game fused with some creative ideas, adding obstacles, power-ups, control snake movement, be careful to avoid walls and obstacles, increase snake functions through power-ups, give you different experience.
ratelimit_description: Rate limiting is a strategy to control the rate of traffic sent or received. Fixed window and sliding window rate limiting are the most common algorithms. This page shows the characteristics and comparison of these two algorithms.
rate_limit_compare: Sliding Window VS Fixed Window Rate Limiting Comparison
tokenbucket_description: Token bucket is a rate limiting algorithm that can be used to control the rate of traffic sent or received. Can set bucket capacity, token generation speed, and request speed, then will draw curves of successful or failed requests.
trie_description: Explore Trie prefix tree operations visualization tool. Interactive animations demonstrate word insertion, search and deletion operations, intuitively understand how Trie tree works.
linkedlist_description: Singly linked list consists of a series of nodes, each containing data and a pointer to the next node. This page shows basic operations of singly linked list including insert, delete, search, etc.
stack_title: Stack Data Structure Visualization Interactive Tool
stack_description: Stack is a LIFO (Last In First Out) queue. This page visualizes basic stack operations including push, pop, adjust stack height, dynamically displays detailed content of stack operations to help understand stack operation principles.
invalidNewHeight: New height is less than current stack size, cannot adjust
hashtable_description: Hash table is used to efficiently store key-value pairs. This page visualizes basic hash table operations including insert, delete, search, etc. Can choose different hash functions and hash table sizes, provides rich data display.
keyNotFound: Key not found. Last checked bucket: {{index}}.
skiplist_description: Skip list is a randomized data structure used to quickly find elements in an ordered linked list. This page shows basic skip list operations including insert, delete, search, etc.
subtitles_title: Online Free Image Subtitle Stitching Tool
subtitles_description: Use this online tool to easily stitch multiple beautiful subtitles to images! Supports custom fonts, colors, sizes and heights, can also add gradient backgrounds and special effects. No software download needed, processed in local browser, images don't need to upload to server, free and secure.
dpcoin_description: Dynamic programming coin change algorithm visualization, set target amount and available coin denominations, click step-by-step calculation button, observe how to find optimal solution step by step. The output state transition process column shows how algorithm builds solution for larger problems from smaller ones.
hashring_description: Consistent hashing hash ring visualization, clearly and intuitively understand consistent hash key distribution, key migration when adding/removing nodes. Also supports setting virtual nodes (shadow nodes) to understand distribution balance optimization effects.
keysOnNode: Number of keys on this node: {{count}}
virtualNodesPerNode: Virtual Nodes per Node (0 means none)
cannotRemoveLastNode: Cannot remove the last remaining node.
bloomfilter_description: Bloom filter is a space-efficient probabilistic data structure used to quickly check if an element is in a set. This page uses grid layout to visualize basic bloom filter operations including insert, search, etc.
jumphash_description: JumpHash is a hash algorithm invented by Google for load balancing in distributed systems. This page shows JumpHash algorithm working principle, by adjusting number of buckets and keys, observe key distribution.

chartrace_description: This tool is used to easily create dynamic racing charts. Simply upload data source file, then customize time, type and data columns to automatically generate beautiful dynamic racing bar charts. Also provides large amounts of data files and generated charts for direct browsing.
dynamicChartsIndexDoc:
Here is a collection of important indicator data that changes over time. Each chart shows key data trends in different fields, allowing you to intuitively understand the historical changes and future directions of various indicators.

Charts cover multiple fields including but not limited to:
- Population Statistics: Show population growth trends of countries worldwide
- Economic Indicators: Present changes in economic data like GDP, inflation rates
- Technology Development: Show evolution of technical indicators like internet users, smartphone penetration rates
- Social Development: Show social progress indicators like education levels, healthcare coverage rates

Each chart uses dynamic bar chart form to make data change process more intuitive and vivid. Some public data also provides download links for your further analysis and research.

You can also use your own private data to generate customized dynamic charts.

population-growth.title: World Population Changes (1800-2015)
population-growth.intro: World population has shown continuous growth trend since 1800, especially significantly accelerated growth rate entering late 19th and early 20th century. Industrial Revolution and economic development in late 19th century improved living conditions in most countries, accelerating population growth. From mid-20th century, developing countries like China and India had extremely rapid population growth. After entering 20th century, high-income countries' population growth rate gradually slowed down.

income-growth.title: Global Income Changes (1800-2015)
income-growth.intro: UK's income in 1800 was already several times higher than many countries, Industrial Revolution greatly widened gap between high-income and other countries. Compared to industrialized countries, income levels in countries like India, China, some African countries didn't change much for most of 19th century. Rapid development of emerging economies like China, India in late 20th and early 21st centuries gradually caught up with high-income countries. Despite overall global income growth in late 20th century, income gap between high-income and low-income countries still exists. Global income changes experienced huge unbalanced development, early dominated by developed countries' income growth driven by Industrial Revolution, later emerging economies' rise brought transformation of income pattern, but global income gap remains significant.

china_gdp.title: China Provincial GDP Changes (2004-2023)
china_gdp.intro: China's economy experienced significant growth in past 20 years. Taking Guangdong as example, its GDP grew from 1,865.83 billion yuan in 2004 to 13,567.32 billion yuan in 2023, about 6.3 times growth. By comparing growth rates in different periods, can find economic growth rate overall shows slowing trend. For example, Guangdong's average annual growth rate was about 14.4% during 2004-2013, slowed to about 8.0% during 2014-2023. This shows China's economy is transitioning from high-speed growth to high-quality development stage. Beijing and Shanghai as municipalities have relatively high total GDP, possibly reflecting their status as financial, technology and service centers. Even when facing global economic challenges (like 2020), most regions maintained positive growth, demonstrating resilience of China's economy.

china_population.title: China Provincial Population Changes (2004-2023)
china_population.intro: Chinese provinces show obvious differentiation trends in population changes. Overall, eastern coastal developed regions (like Beijing, Guangdong, Shanghai) have relatively significant population growth, average increase between 1.5%-2%. These regions attract large floating population, rich economic development and employment opportunities are main reasons. Conversely, northeast regions (like Heilongjiang, Jilin) have negative population growth, Heilongjiang has most severe population decline, decreased 1.15%. These regions face dual pressures of industrial decline and population outflow. In addition, some central and western provinces (like Guizhou, Gansu) also have slowing population growth. Future population change focus may concentrate on relationship between urbanization advancement and widening regional economic development gap, eastern economic centers may continue to attract population, while provinces with single economic structure will face population loss challenges.

china_income.title: China Provincial Fiscal Revenue Changes (2004-2023)
china_income.intro: Analysis reveals significant regional differences in fiscal revenue of Chinese provinces, coastal provinces like Guangdong, Jiangsu have much higher revenue than inland provinces like Tibet, Qinghai, reflecting unbalanced economic development. Despite this, most provinces show continuous growth trend during 2004-2023, reflecting overall development of China's economy. However, recent years' growth rate generally slowed down, possibly reflecting impact of economic transformation and structural adjustment. Notably, some provinces like Guizhou, Tibet have relatively fast fiscal revenue growth, may be closely related to national regional development strategies and support policies. Meanwhile, provinces with diversified economic structure like Guangdong and Zhejiang show stronger resilience when facing economic fluctuations, highlighting importance of industrial diversity for fiscal stability.

china_outcome.title: China Provincial Fiscal Expenditure Changes (2004-2023)
china_outcome.intro: Analysis reveals Chinese provinces' fiscal expenditure shows continuous growth trend, reflecting government continuously increasing investment in people's livelihood and economic development. However, there are significant regional differences in expenditure scale and growth rate, economically developed eastern coastal provinces like Guangdong, Jiangsu have expenditure scale far exceeding western provinces like Qinghai, Ningxia, reflecting huge gap in fiscal strength. Notably, some central and western provinces like Sichuan, Guizhou have relatively fast expenditure growth rate, may be closely related to national regional balanced development strategy.

china_population_more.title: China Provincial Population Birth Rate Changes (2012-2023)
china_population_more.intro: Population birth rate changes of Chinese provinces and cities in different years. From 2012 to 2023, national birth rate shows gradual downward trend. Birth rate was 12.10‰ in 2012, dropped to 6.39‰ in 2023. Birth rate has obvious regional differences, Tibet's birth rate has remained at relatively high level, compared to big cities like Shanghai, Beijing with lower birth rates, 3.95‰ and 5.63‰ respectively in 2023. Although two-child policy restrictions were lifted in middle period, data shows birth rate didn't significantly increase, instead continued to decline in following years. Generally economically developed provinces like Guangdong, Zhejiang have relatively low birth rates.

china_population_more.description: In recent years, population birth rates of Chinese provinces and cities show downward trend, from 12.10‰ in 2012 to 6.39‰ in 2023. Big cities like Beijing and Shanghai have lower birth rates, possibly related to urbanization, living costs and lifestyle changes. Tibet has higher birth rate, reflecting cultural and policy influences. Although comprehensive two-child policy was implemented in 2016, data shows birth rate didn't significantly increase, instead continued to decline in following years, showing limited policy impact. Economically developed provinces like Guangdong, Zhejiang have relatively low birth rates, possibly due to increased living pressure and parenting costs.
china_population_more.keywords: China provincial population birth rate changes, population birth rate linear dynamic chart, population birth rate data visualization

lasermaze_title: Online Free Laser Reflection Puzzle Game
lasermaze_description: Place white reflection blocks in appropriate positions, 45° reflect laser to hit all green targets. Comes with preset levels, supports randomly generating different difficulty levels, supports showing solutions.
lasermaze_random_tip: Higher difficulty means more reflection blocks, needs more reflection planning.
lasermaze_tip_1: Reflection block is located at center of grid, laser only reflects at midpoint of edges.
lasermaze_tip_2: Laser stops when hitting boundary, plan path in advance to let beam sweep all green targets.
lasermaze_tip_3: Drag and release block to place, try different combinations to find new reflection angles.
